artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 509.5; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: man wearing black and white cap, short blue kimono with white swirling patterns and red garment on top, wading through water; woman wearing white garment with multicolored floral medallions clinging to man's back; moon in sky at top center
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫勇 {hori Yū}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Collection of Thirty-six Ghosts in New Style (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
title: Picture of Ōmori Hikoshichi Encountering a Demon on his Path
